metadata.synopsis: The majority of this dialogue only triggers if the player has the quest to find the missing child Vanra from her mother, Lora. This is secretly the hag who is disguised as the real Captain Grisly (who is locked downstairs with a hag mask on - we can potentially save her later, but it's difficult).In this dialogue, Captain Grisly (the hag) asks us to kill Lora, a woman who 'claims' her daughter has gone missing and has caused nothing but trouble for the good Captain.If we refuse, she immediately turns into the hag. If we agree to do it and kill Lora, the hag is delighted and transforms.

12.speaker: Captain Grisly
12.context: NodeContext: hungover out of her tree

30.speaker: Captain Grisly
30.text: You! A little birdie told me that you killed that annoying redhead - Lora was her name. Is that true?
30.context: NodeContext: delight and shock (player has done this without being asked)

15.text: HAH! I can't believe it. You took care of that pain in my arse without me ASKING?
15.context: NodeContext: shocked and DELIGHTED. Almost hooting with joy

100.text: Oh my goodness, that's a yes! HAH! I can't believe it. You took care of that pain in my arse without me asking?
100.context: NodeContext: shocked and DELIGHTED. Almost hooting with joy

83.speaker: Player
83.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

33.speaker: Captain Grisly
33.text: So, will you bring me Lora's head? Or do I have to sleep with one eye open tonight? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
33.context: NodeContext: grumpy, annoyed that player hasn't done it yet

55.speaker: Captain Grisly
55.context: NodeContext: hungover out of her tree

47.speaker: Player
47.text: You're the owner of this place, right? What is going on in your basement?

24.text: You got into my basement? Well, aren't you the shittiest little spoilsport?
24.context: NodeContext: annoyed, her big surprise (that she's a hag) has been ruined

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I see signs of a hag downstairs. Explain yourself.

40.text: Aw, you ruined my big surprise!
40.context: NodeContext: over the top dissappointed - player has discovered she's connected to a hag.

78.speaker: Captain Grisly
78.text: Can't a captain be bloody hungover in peace? Oh - why, hello there.
78.context:
NodeContext: head in hand(s), grumpy - then looks up and sees player - instantly attracted to them
Question in rhetorical tone.

38.text: Captain Grisly at your service. What can I do for a long drink of water like yourself?

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I found this note. Who is 'Auntie'?

23.speaker: Player
23.text: I've been in your basement - why does it look like the lair of a hag?

93.text: You what? Well, aren't the shittiest little spoilsport?
93.context: NodeContext: rolling eyes, player has ruined her charade, a little sulky

53.speaker: Captain Grisly
53.text: Guess there's no point in wearing this old thing anymore.
53.context: NodeContext: gesturing to herself, wry grin - she's about shed her illusion and trasnform into a hag. Excited, dramatic.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: I'm here about a missing girl - Vanra.

108.context: NodeContext: throws eyes to heaven, annoyed

17.text: Listen, Lora was here, all right - knocking back pints like there's no tomorrow. But she was alone. I saw head nor arse of this so-called 'kid'.

43.text: And when we tried to kick her out? She pulled a knife on my front man. Bet she didn't tell you that bit, huh?

114.text: That's 'cause she's taking you for a ride - and not the fun kind.
114.context: NodeContext: yes this is an innuendo

106.speaker: Player
106.text: If Lora's daughter isn't here, where is she?

82.text: Not a notion! But not a soul has seen this so-called Vanra of hers - myself included.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: How do I know you're not lying?

13.text: I run a bar. What use would I have with some little one running around, crying and shitting?
13.context: NodeContext: rolling her eyes like it's the most ridiculous suggestion (it's not, she secretly has vanra)

113.text: Look, I know Lora from my pirating days - she ran with Bart Blackdagger's crew. Heard they tossed her overboard when she gutted the bosun over a game of cards.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: You look like you can handle yourself. Did a little knife cause that much trouble?

110.text: Mate, I've boarded ships with less. And so has Lora.
110.context: NodeContext: thinks the player is a bit stupid, trying to make a point

94.text: She ran with Bart Blackdagger's crew. Heard they tossed her overboard when she gutted the bosun over a game of cards.

102.text: Now, I'd no beef with her before this - all are welcome in the 'Maid. But threatening my staff? Claiming we took her 'kid'? She's bonkers. Dangerous.

27.text: Next time she pulls a knife on me and mine, someone might die. Something has to be done.
27.context: NodeContext: wants the player to offer to kill lora. Very grim, concerned. Worried.

111.text: There's one way and one way only to shut someone up.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I'll talk to her - see if I can calm her down.

116.text: Life has taught me that chatter doesn't cut it.
116.context: NodeContext: deadly serious, a hint at her vicious nature

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Just pay Lora off - that usually works.

61.text: Gold won't stop her stabbing me in my sleep over an imaginary kid.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: A child is missing - I just want to get to the bottom of this.

19.text: Gods - do I have to spell it out for you? There is no child. Lora is mad as a box of frogs.

71.text: She's dangerous - and I couldn't call myself a captain if I stood by and did nothing.
71.context: NodeContext: trying to pitch it as there's no other choice, that Lora must be stopped - manipulating the player

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Lora's child is missing - she pulled her knife in fear and anger. Have you not felt such things?

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Punishment is in order - the girl must learn.

66.text: Oh, we're well past that I'm afraid. She's mad - dangerous. And I couldn't call myself Captain if I let it continue.
66.context: NodeContext: trying to pitch it as there's no other choice, that Lora must be stopped - manipulating the player

3.text: I hate that it's come to this, but I'll pay a hoard of gold to whoever scuppers her. Permanently. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
3.context: NodeContext: should sound regretful. Trying to pitch it as there's no other choice, that Lora must be stopped - manipulating the player

10.text: No less insane than lying about having a kid! If you don't do it, I'll find someone else.

96.text: You can make it painless. Not everyone will.
96.context: NodeContext: trying to make the player see things her way, really being manipulative

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Double that, and you've got a deal.

79.text: A tough negotiator - I like that. You've got yourself a deal.

58.text: Return when the deed is done.

81.text: Good. This is a mercy - I promise.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: I need to think about it.

7.text: Don't take too long - or someone else might get there before you.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I refuse. I'll not harm an innocent.

4.text: Tch, paladins. Biggest bunch of dry-shites I ever laid eyes on.

22.speaker: Captain Grisly
22.text: Oh well! Guess I'll just decorate the room with your insides - they'll match my new carpet beautifully.
22.context: NodeContext: She's about shed her illusion and trasnform into a hag. Excited, dramatic. Vicious.

59.context: CinematicNodeContext: Illusion drops - revealing Auntie Ethel

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Absolutely not - I  refuse to do your dirty work.

90.text: Tch - you're no fun. I wanted you to stain your soul with the blood of an innocent mother.
90.context: NodeContext: we see the act drop, big smile from captain grisly

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Killing Lora sounds like the best way.

117.text: You've had to get your hands dirty before, I see.

46.text: There's drinks aplenty at the bar. Anything else, well - those days are behind me - even for one as fine-looking as yourself.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Doesn't a captain need a ship?

67.text: You're standing in it, smart-arse. Or her innards, at least. She may not sit on water no more, but she'll always be my ship.
67.context: NodeContext: great pride in her old ship

37.speaker: Player
37.text: I'm looking for work. Of the musical variety, preferably.

68.text: 'Fraid I've got that covered already, mate. They ain't tuneful, but they are cheap as piss.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Why don't you tell me why you're so heavily armed? I count no less than three hidden blades.

39.text: Sharp-eyed, aren't you? But you missed a few. I may not sail the seas anymore, but that doesn't mean I'm not ready for trouble. So, behave.
39.context: NodeContext: player has noticed she's heavily armed, smiled at 'you missed a few' (hinting that she's more daggers on her). 'Behave' is both a flirty invitation and a slight threat

87.speaker: Captain Grisly
87.text: Captain Grisly at your service. What can I do for a long drink of water like yourself?

101.text: Is it done? Has Lora stopped that wailing of hers - for good?

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Wait - I have questions. Mainly about your basement - which looks like the lair of a hag.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Of course she's dead - I'm a professional.

76.context: NodeContext: player actually killed lora and she is DELIGHTED. Touch of a maniacal laugh here, at odds with how Grisly has acted before this (in her next line, she uses the hag's real voice and then transforms)

31.speaker: Captain Grisly
31.context:
CinematicNodeContext: This node is spoken by a dummy character that is not in the room.

You will need to make sure that the usual speaker 1 is not visible when this speaker 3 is saying this line.

115.context: CinematicNodeContext: Illusion drops - revealing Auntie Ethel

77.text: Quickly - or I'll find someone else to do it for me.
